name: Melon Nectarine Agua Fresca
description:
You can use any kind of melon that’s available to you during the season. Agua fresca is generally quite thin – the name means “fresh water.”

I like it a little spicy, so top it with a dusting of red pepper powder. Of course, you could turn this into a cocktail with a shot (or two) of tequila. However you serve it, make sure it’s well-chilled and served over plenty of ice.
recipeIngredient: 2  yellow or white nectarines (pitted and sliced)
1 1/2 tablespoons sugar (preferably an unrefined sugar (see Note))

recipeInstructions.text: Puree all the ingredients together in a blender until very smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Puree all the ingredients together in a blender until very smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Pass the mixture through a mesh strainer, pressing it through with a flexible spatula. Chill the agua fresca mixture thoroughly.
recipeInstructions.name: Pass the mixture through a mesh strainer, pressing it through with a flexible spatula. Chill the agua fresca mixture thoroughly.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve well-chilled over ice. Dust with red pepper powder, if desired.
